ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurologic function secondary to hemorrhagic or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event. Infarction or hemorrhage may be demonstrated either directly by imaging,laboratory, or pathologic examination in patients with symptom duration less than 24 hours, or inferred by symptoms lasting greater than or equal to 24 hours (or fatal within 24 hours) that cannot be attributed to another cause.  Diagnostic tests include CT scan, MRI, angiography, and EEG to locate and evaluate the extent of the hemorrhagic or ischemic damage in the brain parenchyma, coagulation studies, complete blood count, comprehensive metabolic panel, and urinalysis.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: NINDS:National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke Common Data Element Project
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/25/18 - smt CDE transferred to NCIP ownership per NINDS (Muniza Sheikh) request.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having no signs or symptoms of disease.: A sudden loss of neurologic function secondary to hemorrhagic or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event. Infarction or hemorrhage may be demonstrated either directly by imaging,laboratory, or pathologic examination in patients with symptom duration less than 24 hours, or inferred by symptoms lasting greater than or equal to 24 hours (or fatal within 24 hours) that cannot be attributed to another cause.  Diagnostic tests include CT scan, MRI, angiography, and EEG to locate and evaluate the extent of the hemorrhagic or ischemic damage in the brain parenchyma, coagulation studies, complete blood count, comprehensive metabolic panel, and urinalysis.

Concepts.definition: Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.
A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intracranial hemorrhage into the subarachnoid space.

Concepts.definition: Intracranial hemorrhage into the subarachnoid space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Located within a ventricle of the brain or heart
: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

Concepts.definition: Located within a ventricle of the brain or heart.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, ocurring in, or situated within the cerebrum.: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

Concepts.definition: Of, ocurring in, or situated within the cerebrum.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.

Concepts.definition: A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

Concepts.definition: An acute episode of focal cerebral, spinal, or retinal dysfunction caused by infarction of brain tissue.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
